thread.title: AFCON 2017: The Premier League players swapping England for Gabon in January
thread.title_full: AFCON 2017: The Premier League players swapping England for Gabon in January

author: Hamish Mackay
title: AFCON 2017: The Premier League players swapping England for Gabon in January
text:
In total, 26 Premier League players are jetting off to Gabon (Photo: Anadolu Agency/AFP/Getty) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
PFA Player of the Year Riyad Mahrez is one of 26 Premier League players heading off to the Africa Cup of Nations this month. 
The 31st edition of the tournament gets underway in Gabon on January 14, with many players having already flown out with their international squads. 
The final will be held at the Stade d'Angondjé on February 5, meaning some English clubs could be without their players for up to four domestic matches. 
Sadio Mane (Senegal), who has been in superb form for Liverpool this season, has already departed while Manchester United will lose £30million defender Eric Bailly (Ivory Coast). 
Benik Afobe, however, withdrew from the Democratic Republic of Congo's squad to concentrate on his Bournemouth career. 
In total, more than half of Premier League clubs will be missing players this month while five teams will be without three of their first team squad members. Islam Slimani (Algeria) will play at AFCON 2017 (Photo: Leicester City FC via Getty) PREMIER LEAGUE PLAYERS HEADING TO GABON: 
Arsenal: Ismael Bennacer (Algeria), Mohamed Elneny (Egypt) 
Bournemouth: Max Gradel (Ivory Coast) 
Crystal Palace: Bakary Sako (Mali), Wilfried Zaha (Ivory Coast), 
Everton: Idrissa Gueye (Senegal) Everton will lose Idrissa Gueye (Senegal) (Photo: Plumb Images) 
Hull City: Ahmed Elmohamady (Egypt), Dieumerci Mbokani (DR Congo) 
Leicester City: Daniel Amartey (Ghana), Riyad Mahrez (Algeria), Islam Slimani (Algeria), 
Liverpool: Sadio Mane (Senegal) 
Manchester United: Eric Bailly (Ivory Coast) 
Southampton: Sofiane Boufal (Morocco) West Ham's record signing Andre Ayew will join up with his Ghana team-mates (Photo: Arfa Griffiths) 
Stoke: Wilfried Bony (Ivory Coast), Mame Biram Diouf (Senegal), Ramadan Sobhi (Egypt) 
Sunderland: Wahbi Khazri (Tunisia), Lamine Kone (Ivory Coast), Didier Ndong (Gabon) 
Watford: Nordin Amrabat (Morocco), Brice Dja Djedje (Ivory Coast), Adlene Guedioura (Algeria) 
West Ham: Andre Ayew (Ghana), Sofiane Feghouli (Algeria), Cheikou Kouyate (Senegal) Like us on Facebook
